main event: A UFO sighting occurred on 3 September 1956 in Washington, D.C. The object was described as the size of a D2G at arm's length, moving with vertical motions, and observed for about 2 minutes at approximately 15 degrees elevation.
interesting points: The observer concluded that the object was probably caused by a temperature inversion, although its behavior did not fully support this conclusion.
The report states that the object was originally reported as due east of College Park MD and National Airport.
The object was observed for 20 minutes and was surrounded by occasional aurora, with no sound reported.
Weather data from Bolling AFB indicated two inversions and two near inversions over the Washington area, and a clear sighting of the planet Mars in an otherwise starless sky.
The report mentions a ground visual sighting by Mr. Tavel at 1040 EDT, observed by other witnesses, with no stars in the sky and slight overcast.
sighted object: one UFO, described as the size of a D2G at arm's length, moving with vertical motions
